body:
$!
Your payments may go down or stop if your circumstances change or your details change.
$!

Your payments may have gone down or stopped because:

* your award notice shows you have been overpaid
* you haven't [renewed](/renewing-your-tax-credits-claim "Renew your tax credits") your tax credits claim
* your income is too high for [Working Tax Credit](/working-tax-credit "Working Tax Credit") or [Child Tax Credit](/child-tax-credit "Child Tax Credit")
* your income has gone up by more than £10,000
* payments for having a baby under the age of 1 stopped 6 April 2012

They can also change if you don't tell the Tax Credit Office: 

* that your child is 16 and staying in [education or training](/child-benefit-16-19 "Approved education or training")
* you've changed your bank, building society or Post Office account
* you've changed address

##What to do 

[Report changes](/changes-that-affect-your-tax-credits "Changes that affect your tax credits") to your work or family life to the Tax Credit Office because these changes affect how much money you get. 

$C 
**Tax Credit Helpline**  
Telephone: 0345 300 3900    
Textphone: 0345 300 3909   
$C
overview: Reasons why your tax credits go down or stop and what you can do about it
